name: TheAtlantic
text: The pandemic has made it harder to see friends in person. But it has also released us from the expectation that closeness requires physical proximity. That could allow new ways for friendships to flourish, writes @evahagberg. https://t.co/F7I2IgsBgM

name: TheAtlantic
text: Instead of individual episodes that impinge upon us, like bombs lobbed by an angry god, disasters are now an ongoing and possibly permanent texture to our lives, writes @Emma_Marris. And we cannot forget—these are disasters. https://t.co/VhbmI7SPnt

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Even if term limits wouldn't change the Court's decision making, they might be worth trying anyway, because at least there would be less randomness about when vacancies arise," @ishapiro writes: https://t.co/GoQqn6wMWm

name: TheAtlantic
text: Ruth Bader Ginsburg's death has revived debates about court packing. Last month, Ryan D. Doerfler and Samuel Moyn argued for a different type of court reform—one that would disempower the institution itself, rather than merely adjust its personnel. https://t.co/cj9eMSUabb

name: TheAtlantic
text: Trump is making it harder for swing-state senators to survive a tough Supreme Court confirmation fight, writes @PeterAtlantic. https://t.co/L3HyxKVjKy

name: TheAtlantic
text: Time again for a look at the animal kingdom and our interactions with the countless species that share our planet, via @theAtlPhoto: https://t.co/m34l6bhlwQ https://t.co/EwiV6w1ufv

name: TheAtlantic
text: The political fight to replace the late Ruth Bader Ginsburg is coming. Then: What do fall TV lineups look like? The latest Atlantic Daily, by @mimbsy: https://t.co/sNPuzNdLRW

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Let us not hedge about one thing," @bartongellman writes. "Donald Trump may win or lose, but he will never concede." Who will stop him from throwing the election into chaos? https://t.co/DhmftDn1nz

name: TheAtlantic
text: Another tragic milestone arrives. We’re pausing to reflect, both on what led up to this moment and on the grief that undergirds it. The latest Atlantic Daily, by @mimbsy: https://t.co/H9tY6o14eo

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @bartongellman: When Trump refuses to concede, the cascading effects could break our fragile transition of power. My new cover story in @TheAtlantic. https://t.co/l98m2QRszn

name: TheAtlantic
text: "While election law and voting rights might seem to have become nakedly partisan, only one side is actually favoring democracy," @LeahLitman writes: https://t.co/mId5CjCIHn

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @shirklesxp: It's Day 3 of #TheAtlanticFest! I spoke to @ayeshacurry about pandemic parenting and her new cookbook while a pint-sized Zoom bomber dropped by. (Not that I could tell—I was staring at a wall. Moderating remotely is odd.)

Stream here tonight! https://t.co/Vho6VPCnlQ @TheAtlantic

name: TheAtlantic

name: TheAtlantic
text: Anthony Fauci says he told the political appointee Paul Alexander to “take a hike” when Alexander tried to censor his pandemic guidance. But he's concerned about the winter ahead, @alexismadrigal reports: https://t.co/8HkFkhX9hs
